Telstra workplace health and safety indicators1
1 - Data refers to FY23 Telstra Group Direct headcount as defined above.
2 - From FY20, only claims with activity within the most recent one month are counted as 'open'. Previously claims with activity within the most recent four months were counted as 'open'.
3 - We have restated data from previous years to report on new acceptable workers' comepnsation claims only.
Telstra Total Recordable Injury Frequency Rate1
1 - Data refers to FY23 Telstra Group Direct headcount as defined above.
2 - In 2019, we updated how we calculate our TRIFR to include mental health incidents and remove claims that were rejected.
3 - TRIFR refers to the rate of occurrence of all injuries requiring intervention beyond simple first aid.
4 - We have restated data from FY22 to account for increase in TRIFR due to escalation in injury severity post initial report.
Telstra Lost Time Injury Performance Indicators1,2,3
1 - Data refers to FY23 Telstra Group Direct headcount as defined above.
2 - LTIFR is the reported number per million hours worked of all work-related injuries or diseases that result in one or more days of lost time (for Australian-based Telstra employees).

4 - We have restated data from FY22 to account for increase in LTIFR due to escalation in injury severity post initial report.
